Exact ISO from back in the day.  If you are looking to get it out of the long extinct MIV2 (Motion  Pixels) format, there is a simple way to convert it to modern AVI. Once converted to modern AVI the format possibilities are endless (change to MP4, burn to DVD, etc).

All you have to do is mount the .ISO and extract the AVI file from the "VIDEOS" folder. Once extracted, begin the recoding process via a great open source application called VirtualDub.

http://www.virtualdub.org/download.html

Open VirtualDub, choose the AVI file and then go to File->Save as AVI.

Let it finish the process and you're good to go. After that, it is no longer using the MIV2 codec, so you are free to throw the file into Handbrake or Nero and encode away.  I hope this helps someone out there. It would have saved me two hours of research. :-)
